caption:
This photograph features a large, dark-colored tugboat named "Mary Rose Brusco" prominently in the foreground, navigating through a water body. The tugboat is equipped with a prominent wheelhouse and multiple antennas on top, and it is flying an American flag at the stern. The background shows a lush, densely wooded hill with what appears to be residential housing subtly visible on the hilltop.

To the right of the image, a shoreline is visible with a pile of driftwood and logs scattered across it. A lone person is standing on this rocky, log-strewn shoreline, looking towards the advancing tugboat. The person is wearing dark clothing and is distantly positioned, providing a sense of scale against the vast natural landscape.

The overall environment suggests a serene, perhaps Pacific Northwestern setting, with overcast skies and calm waters reflecting a sense of quiet industry and natural beauty. The tugboat, possibly engaged in a routine task, hints at human activity and commerce occurring within this tranquil scene.
title: Fishing on the Columbia River near weyerhauser pulp mill outfall
